subject: Re: [junit] verbose output from assert?
msgSnippet: ... Why wouldn t your tests be executed? Are you worried that you are building test suites incorrectly or that the test runners are broken? Or is it something
messageBody:
Ray Kiddy wrote:
>
> Sorry if this is an obvious question.
>
> I want to set a test to be verbose and then, sometimes, I want to see
> output from my assert methods whether they pass or fail. Say that I
> want to make sure all the tests are actually getting called.

Why wouldn't your tests be executed? Are you worried that you are
building test suites incorrectly or that the test runners are broken? Or
is it something else?

> I have implemented a trivial over-ride of assertTrue(message,
> condition) that checks a flag and, if debugging, calls the super and
> than logs "PASS: "+message.
>
> But it seems that one should be able to call all the assert methods in
> a verbose mode and get the output.

Nope. You're the first person I've seen on this list who wanted this
feature.

> Is there a reason this rather simple extension is not in the junit
> classes?

Yep. No-one wanted it until now.
